summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan scheduling a telephone conference for jury selection matters in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case. It provides public access information for the audio feed of the proceeding and outlines prohibitions against recording.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this court order is issued.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this order scheduling the telephone conference.

events.title: Jury Selection Telephone Conference
events.description: The court schedules a telephone conference to discuss jury selection matters for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Judge Alison J. Nathan scheduled a telephone conference for October 21, 2021 to discuss jury selection in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The court provided public access to the live audio feed of the proceeding via telephone with specific access codes.
The order explicitly prohibits photographing, recording, or rebroadcasting of the federal court proceedings, with potential fines or sanctions for violations.
Counsel for both sides, the defendant, alleged victims, and family members of the defendant would receive an additional private dial-in number.
This document shows the procedural stage of the Maxwell case in October 2021, moving toward jury selection for trial.
